full_text_rules.rule: Extract ALL text from the page, regardless of its perceived importance or relevance.
Maintain the original reading order of the text as it would be read by a human.
Assign a unique sequential ID to every element (elem_001, elem_002, etc.). IDs must never repeat within a document.
Assign an order number to every element reflecting its position in the reading sequence. Order must be sequential (1, 2, 3...) with no gaps.
Do not omit any textual content, including headers, footers, captions, or footnotes.
Preserve the relationship between different text elements using the ref attribute (e.g., footnotes referencing their source paragraph).
Do not attempt to interpret or summarize the content; extract it verbatim.
If text is present in images, extract and include it in your response as a figure element with alt_text.
For multi-language documents, extract text in all present languages without translation.
Ensure proper spacing between words, hyphens as needed, and proper punctuation as a whole in your output.

Use the correct element type from the dictionary. When in doubt: - Large/bold text at section starts = h1, h2, h3 - Regular body text = paragraph - Text below images/charts = caption - Small text at page bottom with reference marks = footnote
Decorative elements, watermarks, and purely visual content with no informational value should be typed as "artifact" or omitted entirely.
